title.native: プリティーリズム・オーロラドリーム

description:
Prism Stars are performers on the new popular ice show, Prism Show. They are superidols whose techniques, singing and fashion sense are a cut above all others. Aira and Rizumu are two Prism Stars whose goal is to become the best, the Prism Queen. However, the road to success is bumpy.

(Source: AniDB)

__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/punipoyo)

A Japanese animator, character designer, and animation director currently living in Tokyo, Japan. He often goes by the pseudonym Poyoyon Rock.  He is also a member of the doujinshi circle Pokopii.  

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

__Height:__ 154 cm
__Hobbies:__ Film appreciation


She is a voice actress affiliated with 81 Produce. Member of LISP

[Profile](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=277) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LISP20100730) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sayuri_Hara) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%8E%9F%E7%B4%97%E5%8F%8B%E9%87%8C) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/29439.html)

**Non-anime roles:**
• Nekomiya Mana - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sei_kou) | [Website](https://www.himemiko.co/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/長岡成貢)

A self-taught composer and arranger.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/254528/)._
**Tomoko Fukunaga** is a Japanese animator and animation director.
**Iizuka Masanori** is a Japanese character and prop designer, animator, animation supervisor and animation director.

Prizmmy☆ is a Japanese girl group formed by Avex Entertainment in 2012 that was involved in the promotion of the [Pretty Rhythm](https://anilist.co/anime/10257/Pretty-Rhythm-Aurora-Dream/) anime series. Their activities included doing live-action segments at the end of each episode, recording music videos for ending theme song performances, and holding various concerts and events in Japan. Fictionalized versions of the group members appear as the main characters in [Pretty Rhythm: Dear My Future](https://anilist.co/anime/12863/Pretty-Rhythm-Dear-My-Future/). They continued to perform theme songs for the series' successor, [PriPara](https://anilist.co/anime/20742/PriPara/). Following the end of PriPara, Prizmmy☆ disbanded on March 31, 2017.

The members of Prizmmy☆ are:
- Mia Kusakabe
- Reina Kubo
- Karin Takahashi
- Ayami Sema (until March 30, 2014)
- Hina Miyazaki (since April 5, 2014)
